page.title: 13WARDEN - OLD WINCHESTER HILL
page.content: Our site includes a pre-historic hill fort which has been designated a National Nature Reserve since 1954 because of its importance for Conservation. It is one of many 'NNR's in Britain which protect key wildlife habitats, so maintaining a valuable national heritage. The habitat found at Old Winchester hill is chalk downland and is characterised by many rare and beautiful plant and butterfly species, and maintained by a flock of sheep. There are two wardens on site and we work for the Nature Conservancy Council.Our work involves patroling, fending our sheep, fencing, tree felling, wildlife surveys, educational and management planing. A wonderful occupation !
